intro: Ziziphus exserta, commonly known as the African date palm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small tree or shrub that typically grows up to 3 meters in height. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in panicles, followed by small, edible fruits. Its leaves are pinnate, with long, narrow leaflets, and it thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. Ziziphus exserta is well adapted to drought conditions and is often found in rocky soils.
